snippet: Confidence grew in October to its highest level in nearly five years, encouraged by recent declines in the jobless rate.
abstract: Conference Board reports that American consumers are growing more confident and spending more, with consumer confidence surging to its highest level in nearly five years; consumer confidence index rose to 72.2 in October, its highest reading since February 2008; Labor Dept reports weekly unemployment applications fell 9,000 to 363,000 in previous week.
lead_paragraph: Confidence grew in October to its highest level in nearly five years, encouraged by recent declines in the jobless rate.

headline.seo: Consumer Confidence and Spending Rise, Reports Show
headline.main: Consumer Confidence and Spending Are Rising, Economic Reports Show
headline.print_headline: Consumer Confidence and Spending Are Rising, Economic Reports Show
